  <script type="text/javascript">
    (function() {
        var contextPath = '/jira';
        var eventBuffer = [];

        function printDeprecatedMsg() {
            if (console && console.warn) {
                console.warn('DEPRECATED JS - contextPath global variable has been deprecated since 7.4.0. Use `wrm/context-path` module instead.');
            }
        }

        function sendEvent(analytics, postfix) {
            analytics.send({
                name: 'js.globals.contextPath.' + postfix
            });
        }

        function sendDeprecatedEvent(postfix) {
            try {
                var analytics = require('jira/analytics');
                if (eventBuffer.length) {
                    eventBuffer.forEach(function(value) {
                        sendEvent(analytics, value);
                    });
                    eventBuffer = [];
                }

                if (postfix) {
                    sendEvent(analytics, postfix);
                }
            } catch(ex) {
                eventBuffer.push(postfix);
                setTimeout(sendDeprecatedEvent, 1000);
            }
        }

        Object.defineProperty(window, 'contextPath', {
            get: function() {
                printDeprecatedMsg();
                sendDeprecatedEvent('get');
                return contextPath;
            },
            set: function(value) {
                printDeprecatedMsg();
                sendDeprecatedEvent('set');
                contextPath = value;
            }
        });
    })();

</script>

                   <dd> 
                    <span id="reporter-val" class="view-issue-field"> <span class="user-hover" id="issue_summary_reporter_avati" rel="avati" data-user="{&quot;avatarUrl&quot;:&quot;https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452&quot;,&quot;displayName&quot;:&quot;Anand Avati&quot;,&quot;emailAddress&quot;:&quot;avati@apache.org&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;avati&quot;}"> <span class="aui-avatar aui-avatar-small"><span class="aui-avatar-inner"><img src="https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/useravatar?size=small&amp;avatarId=10452" alt="avati"></span></span> Anand Avati </span> </span> 
                   </dd> 
                  </dl> </li> 
                </ul> 
                <ul class="item-details"> 
                 <li> 
                  <dl>

                    Votes:
                   </dt>

class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eSebastian, at this point I am exploring things (mostly digging around the internals of Mahout to understand what are the possible points of integration). At a high level, the thinking is that Mahout will be \\\"depending\\\" on h2o (like how it \\\"depends on\\\" Spark), and there will be enough infrastructure implementations (like Matrix, Vector, possibly Job) which would allow for existing algorithms to be easily refactored to use H2O in place of (or along with), say, Hadoop\\/MR and\\/or DistributedRowMatrix etc.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAs I said, very much open to hear feedback and thoughts on integration patterns.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"avati\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956194_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=avati\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"avati\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Anand Avati\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956194_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 07:41\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T07:41:36+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 07:41\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Sebastian, at this point I am exploring things (mostly digging around the internals of Mahout to understand what are the possible points of integration). At a high level, the thinking is that Mahout will be \\\"depending\\\" on h2o (like how it \\\"depends on\\\" Spark), and there will be enough infrastructure implementations (like Matrix, Vector, possibly Job) which would allow for existing algorithms to be easily refactored to use H2O in place of (or along with), say, Hadoop\\/MR and\\/or DistributedRowMatrix etc. \\n\\n As I said, very much open to hear feedback and thoughts on integration patterns.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956246_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956246_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 08:32\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T08:32:11+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 08:32\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eout will be \\\"depending\\\" on h2o (like how it \\\"depends on\\\" Spark), and there will be enough infrastructure implementations (like Matrix, Vector, possibly Job) which would allow for existing algorithms to be easily refactored to use H2O in place of (or along with), say, Hadoop\\/MR and\\/or DistributedRowMatrix etc.\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e@Anand: Mahout does not \\\"depend on spark\\\" at the Matrix and Vector API. Instead, integration with Spark is on physical plan operator layer and a completely separate logical layer matrix representation (DrmLike, etc) in order to cleanly separate \\\"shared mem\\\" and \\\"shared nothing\\\" use cases. And of course, no Spark actual dependencies ever sip into mahout-math module. We actually spent a lot of effort to unmarry that module from even Hadoop dependencies, IIRC.  I expect it to stay the same.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eo.a.m.math.Matrix and Vector API are reserved for in-core operations only, and all algorithms around it are built assuming \\\"shared memory\\\" model (i.e. they don\'t see it as a problem to iterate over all non-zeros in a single thread). Dumping \\\"shared nothing\\\" and \\\"shared mem\\\" use cases into single api in my not so humble opinion makes no sense to me (unless the proposal is to work towards \\\"unholy mess\\\"  architectural standards.) \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThis would be confusing to devs to no end. No algorithm IMO can be written to be completely agnostic of \\\"shared-mem\\\" vs. \\\"shared nothing\\\" issues. I.e. distributed functional stuff will be able of course to work in a single machine, but this simply amounts to logic \\\"write everything as if it is distributed using FP\\\", so this is not the answer.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eSo  -1 on this. This is not nearly the same as how Spark was integrated.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eMy suggestion is to either integrate with linear algebra optimizer at physical layer (which it seems to be quite impossible to me today because of h2o programming model), absent of which i\'d suggest to start on completely yet-another set of \\\"shared-nothing\\\" api just like it was done for Spark. Of course, we\'d be incoherent here once again, which is why i\'d not like even this &#8211; this might as well be a happily standalone or contrib project with no common parts.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eMessing with Job API is less objectionable I guess, since Job is a shared-nothing api to begin with; however, you are providing too few details to make a sensible opinion on this, so -0 on this at this point.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956246_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956246_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 08:32\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T08:32:11+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 08:32\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                     out will be \\\"depending\\\" on h2o (like how it \\\"depends on\\\" Spark), and there will be enough infrastructure implementations (like Matrix, Vector, possibly Job) which would allow for existing algorithms to be easily refactored to use H2O in place of (or along with), say, Hadoop\\/MR and\\/or DistributedRowMatrix etc.  \\n\\n @Anand: Mahout does not \\\"depend on spark\\\" at the Matrix and Vector API. Instead, integration with Spark is on physical plan operator layer and a completely separate logical layer matrix representation (DrmLike, etc) in order to cleanly separate \\\"shared mem\\\" and \\\"shared nothing\\\" use cases. And of course, no Spark actual dependencies ever sip into mahout-math module. We actually spent a lot of effort to unmarry that module from even Hadoop dependencies, IIRC.  I expect it to stay the same. \\n\\n o.a.m.math.Matrix and Vector API are reserved for in-core operations only, and all algorithms around it are built assuming \\\"shared memory\\\" model (i.e. they don\'t see it as a problem to iterate over all non-zeros in a single thread). Dumping \\\"shared nothing\\\" and \\\"shared mem\\\" use cases into single api in my not so humble opinion makes no sense to me (unless the proposal is to work towards \\\"unholy mess\\\"  architectural standards.)  \\n\\n This would be confusing to devs to no end. No algorithm IMO can be written to be completely agnostic of \\\"shared-mem\\\" vs. \\\"shared nothing\\\" issues. I.e. distributed functional stuff will be able of course to work in a single machine, but this simply amounts to logic \\\"write everything as if it is distributed using FP\\\", so this is not the answer. \\n\\n So  -1 on this. This is not nearly the same as how Spark was integrated. \\n\\n My suggestion is to either integrate with linear algebra optimizer at physical layer (which it seems to be quite impossible to me today because of h2o programming model), absent of which i\'d suggest to start on completely yet-another set of \\\"shared-nothing\\\" api just like it was done for Spark. Of course, we\'d be incoherent here once again, which is why i\'d not like even this &#8211; this might as well be a happily standalone or contrib project with no common parts. \\n\\n Messing with Job API is less objectionable I guess, since Job is a shared-nothing api to begin with; however, you are providing too few details to make a sensible opinion on this, so -0 on this at this point. Hope that clarifies.\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\u003cp\u003eYes. i understood that. I actually don\'t object that. But if you try to read again, you\'d see that\'s not what i was objecting in your explanation.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eJira is usually N-way discussion, but if you don\'t like me quoting your answers to specific comments, i object to this approach specifically &#8211;  \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eStart with providing implementations of AbstractMatrix and AbstractVector, and more as we make progress.\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956259_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956259_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 08:43\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T08:43:54+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 08:43\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 01\\/Apr\\/14 08:50\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e                    ... mplying that no pieces of h2o was planned to be \\\"moved\\\", but have a project level \\\"dependency\\\" (in maven build, and distribution etc.) \\u2013 just like how the Spark bindings work was done. \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eo.a.m.math.Matrix and Vector API are reserved for in-core operations only, and all algorithms around it are built assuming \\\"shared memory\\\" model\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eIn particular, to that end, the cost-optimized approach for in-core math vector operations written by Robin assumes in-core only cost models. It absolutely isn\'t compatible with any notion of a distributed vector, and messing with these cost optimizations is the last thing i\'d like to suggest here. Not to mention outer user block algorithms. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eWhich is a strong argument as to why those two approaches to cost optimization (in-core vs. distributed) should really be kept strictly apart in two separate wards with cotton blankets on the walls and under 24hr monitoring.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956282_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956282_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 09:08\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T09:08:57+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 09:08\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                     o.a.m.math.Matrix and Vector API are reserved for in-core operations only, and all algorithms around it are built assuming \\\"shared memory\\\" model  \\n\\n In particular, to that end, the cost-optimized approach for in-core math vector operations written by Robin assumes in-core only cost models. It absolutely isn\'t compatible with any notion of a distributed vector, and messing with these cost optimizations is the last thing i\'d like to suggest here. Not to mention outer user block algorithms.  \\n\\n Which is a strong argument as to why those two approaches to cost optimization (in-core vs. distributed) should really be kept strictly apart in two separate wards with cotton blankets on the walls and under 24hr monitoring.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956824_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 17:55\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T17:55:58+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 17:55\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 01\\/Apr\\/14 18:01\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eNow it seems to me (with my limited exploring of Mahout) that it might actually be viable to provide a \\\"hadoop alternative\\\" in the form of an alternate implementation of DistributedRowMatrix (instead of AbstractMatrix) \u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eyes that\'s what i meant. On Scala side, this is done by introducing mix-ins DrmLike, RLikeOps, RLikeDrmOps, RLikeVectorOps etc.etc. On java side, working with mix-ins (functionality-filled traits) is of course not easy, but the important point is that it should be an alternative hierarchy with an identical intersection of optimized linalg operators (operator-oriented semantics in linear algebra). \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI. e. assumption is that to the end user (developer) it is more important that notation\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003ea dot b\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e \\n\\n\u003cp\u003emeans exactly the same regardless of whether a and b in-core or distributed; but it matters significantly less whether a and b descend from different hierarchies (e.g. Matrix or DRM), as long as operator dot(A,B) is defined for all possible type combinations (sparse, dense, distributed).\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eand AbstractJob (by internally using h2o\'s Frame\\/Vec and MRTask2 APIs), and thereby allow for a runtime choice of Hadoop vs H2O. \u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI care significantly less about Job api and Hadoop MR in particular. It is my belief they are non-essential to the math user and therefore should be avoided altogether (and such notion is eliminated in Spark Bindings)\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eThis seems like a reasonable first step?\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\u003cp\u003eYes &#8211; with caveat that logical mix-ins for distributed and in-core already exists in Scala and Spark Bindings. Like i said, ideally mapping this logical layer into a particular physical layer seems to be an indefinitely better architecture to me, than creating yet-another logical layer specific to a particular back. However, i see that it would be hard to converge on that, or at least i don\'t see how. I will extract an architecture slide from my talk and post a link to illustrate the idea a bit later.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956824_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956824_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 17:55\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T17:55:58+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 17:55\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 01\\/Apr\\/14 18:01\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e                    Now it seems to me (with my limited exploring of Mahout) that it might actually be viable to provide a \\\"hadoop alternative\\\" in the form of an alternate implementation of DistributedRowMatrix (instead of AbstractMatrix)   \\n\\n yes that\'s what i meant. On Scala side, this is done by introducing mix-ins DrmLike, RLikeOps, RLikeDrmOps, RLikeVectorOps etc.etc. On java side, working with mix-ins (functionality-filled traits) is of course not easy, but the important point is that it should be an alternative hierarchy with an identical intersection of optimized linalg operators (operator-oriented semantics in linear algebra).  \\n\\n I. e. assumption is that to the end user (developer) it is more important that notation \\n  \\n a dot b\\n \\n   \\n\\n means exactly the same regardless of whether a and b in-core or distributed; but it matters significantly less whether a and b descend from different hierarchies (e.g. Matrix or DRM), as long as operator dot(A,B) is defined for all possible type combinations (sparse, dense, distributed). \\n\\n  and AbstractJob (by internally using h2o\'s Frame\\/Vec and MRTask2 APIs), and thereby allow for a runtime choice of Hadoop vs H2O.   \\n\\n I care significantly less about Job api and Hadoop MR in particular. It is my belief they are non-essential to the math user and therefore should be avoided altogether (and such notion is eliminated in Spark Bindings) \\n\\n  This seems like a reasonable first step?  \\n Yes &#8211; with caveat that logical mix-ins for distributed and in-core already exists in Scala and Spark Bindings. Like i said, ideally mapping this logical layer into a particular physical layer seems to be an indefinitely better architecture to me, than creating yet-another logical layer specific to a particular back. However, i see that it would be hard to converge on that, or at least i don\'t see how. I will extract an architecture slide from my talk and post a link to illustrate the idea a bit later.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13956841\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956898_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 18:52\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T18:52:38+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 18:52\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhat is the \\\"Algebraic DSL\\\"? Is that the one which came with the scala bindings (with \\\"%*%\\\" operator etc.)?\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThere are two sets of operators &#8211; for mahout-math (in-core), i call it scala bindings and it is in the math-scala. It doesn\'t do much actually but just providing a syntactic sugar for passing off things to in-core cost-based optimizers (where they are implemented). \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThe second set of DSL is for (looking identically to in-core set of operators)  is for distributed stuff. (on diagram those two are not visually separated other than there\'s just part of it over in-core and part of it over distributed optimizer).\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eToday, what distinguishes \\\"Logical translation layer\\\" vs \\\"Physical translation layer\\\" in the code? What parts of the code is considered to be the \\\"Logical translation layer\\\"? \u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eWell you need to keep in perspective that distributed optimizer part was done in like 3 days and it is now fairly tightly bound to spark code so separation at this point is not very clean until we introduce another engine (which is coming). Obviously at the time of introducing second engine, this needs to be abstracted in a separate module without spark dependencies.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eLogical translation is everything in drm.plan (operators implementing DrmLike[] ). \u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nPhysical translation to Spark is CheckpointedDrm, CheckpointAction and everything in blas package (actual spark specific support for physical plan after optimization run). \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\u003cp\u003eIs the selection of \\\"physical translation layer\\\" a run-time decision?\u003c\\/p\u003e\u003c\\/blockquote\u003e\\n\u003cp\u003eyes it is run time optimizer action based on operand types, geometry (size), orientation and partitioning. (very similar in fact to what happens in Pig graph, except such graph rewrites are much more elegant in Scala).\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956898_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956898_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 18:52\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T18:52:38+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 18:52\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                     What is the \\\"Algebraic DSL\\\"? Is that the one which came with the scala bindings (with \\\"%*%\\\" operator etc.)?  \\n\\n There are two sets of operators &#8211; for mahout-math (in-core), i call it scala bindings and it is in the math-scala. It doesn\'t do much actually but just providing a syntactic sugar for passing off things to in-core cost-based optimizers (where they are implemented).  \\n\\n The second set of DSL is for (looking identically to in-core set of operators)  is for distributed stuff. (on diagram those two are not visually separated other than there\'s just part of it over in-core and part of it over distributed optimizer). \\n\\n  Today, what distinguishes \\\"Logical translation layer\\\" vs \\\"Physical translation layer\\\" in the code? What parts of the code is considered to be the \\\"Logical translation layer\\\"?   \\n\\n Well you need to keep in perspective that distributed optimizer part was done in like 3 days and it is now fairly tightly bound to spark code so separation at this point is not very clean until we introduce another engine (which is coming). Obviously at the time of introducing second engine, this needs to be abstracted in a separate module without spark dependencies. \\n\\n Logical translation is everything in drm.plan (operators implementing DrmLike[] ).  \\nPhysical translation to Spark is CheckpointedDrm, CheckpointAction and everything in blas package (actual spark specific support for physical plan after optimization run).  \\n\\n  Is the selection of \\\"physical translation layer\\\" a run-time decision?  \\n yes it is run time optimizer action based on operand types, geometry (size), orientation and partitioning. (very similar in fact to what happens in Pig graph, except such graph rewrites are much more elegant in Scala). \\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13956908\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n from in-core hierarchy of things. However, it doesn\'t have a notion of optimizer and algebraic expression checkpoints, so it was not coherently usable for that approach.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13956908_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13956908_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'01\\/Apr\\/14 19:04\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-01T19:04:46+0000\'\u003e01\\/Apr\\/14 19:04\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    PS in java\\/MR world, DRM also already has representation, it is DistributedRowMatrix class, and it is also totally separate hierarchy from in-core hierarchy of things. However, it doesn\'t have a notion of optimizer and algebraic expression checkpoints, so it was not coherently usable for that approach.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13957216\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1500?focusedCommentId=13957216&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13957216\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13957216_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13957216_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'02\\/Apr\\/14 01:09\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-02T01:09:30+0000\'\u003e02\\/Apr\\/14 01:09\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 02\\/Apr\\/14 01:12\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003e@Anand, Bottom line, the core of AbstractMatrix and Vector is elementwise iterators and direct element accessors. Lacking closure(functional) programming, they don\'t work for the distributed stuff. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThere are two ways with such approach: either declare core abstractions unsupported in distributed implementation, which just proves AbstractMatrix and Vector are not good abstractions for that work. (why would one need an abstraction, if its major and core contracts are all of a sudden declared optional or deprecated). \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eTruth to be told, there is some Matrix api that uses FP &#8211; two major things are aggregate() and assign(). However, this still doesn\'t get us anywhere in a sense that we should support \u003cem\u003eall\u003c\\/em\u003e core contracts, not just assign() and aggregate().\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eAnother way of going about it is to heavily refactor core abstraction in favor of functional support, while deprecating or eliminating direct access. I call this \\\"nuclear option\\\". Because it sends ripple effects not only thru Mahout, but thru any 3rd party code that uses mahout-math. (in my case specifically). It will force people reconsider using mahout because of stability issues in the areas where it was promised to be stable.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eExtending DistributedRowMatrix api.. I kind of dubious about it as well, since it is also unusable without major FP infusion, and frankly kind of ancient.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eMore likely, a completely new FP-laced distributed Matrix representation is desired. SparkBindings went that path and created FP-laced DRM api. But this is entirely Scala side abstraction, with Scala function literals etc. So if you are looking to create a java distributed matrix abstraction, this is not going to be useful at all either.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eSo more likely, you need a completely new FP-oriented java API interface. Something like X2OMatrix.java. This will fragment project even further, but all marketing fluff excluding, that\'s the only realistic option i see that might work. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI would also question (kinda) the wisdom of a standalone distributed vector abstraction. On Hadoop side and spark side this abstraction is completely bypassed (it is assumed that real vector will always fit into single machine memory). In situations where vector might be formed as a result of distributed operation (e.g. A %*% x) the result is simply a distributed single-column matrix, from which the column can be always collected in front end via collection\\/slicing api. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n                                            \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13957216_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13957216_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'02\\/Apr\\/14 01:09\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-02T01:09:30+0000\'\u003e02\\/Apr\\/14 01:09\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e   - \u003cspan class=\\\"redText subText\\\" title=\\\"Dmitriy Lyubimov - 02\\/Apr\\/14 01:12\\\"\u003eedited\u003c\\/span\u003e                   @Anand, Bottom line, the core of AbstractMatrix and Vector is elementwise iterators and direct element accessors. Lacking closure(functional) programming, they don\'t work for the distributed stuff.  \\n\\n There are two ways with such approach: either declare core abstractions unsupported in distributed implementation, which just proves AbstractMatrix and Vector are not good abstractions for that work. (why would one need an abstraction, if its major and core contracts are all of a sudden declared optional or deprecated).  \\n\\n Truth to be told, there is some Matrix api that uses FP &#8211; two major things are aggregate() and assign(). However, this still doesn\'t get us anywhere in a sense that we should support  all  core contracts, not just assign() and aggregate(). \\n\\n Another way of going about it is to heavily refactor core abstraction in favor of functional support, while deprecating or eliminating direct access. I call this \\\"nuclear option\\\". Because it sends ripple effects not only thru Mahout, but thru any 3rd party code that uses mahout-math. (in my case specifically). It will force people reconsider using mahout because of stability issues in the areas where it was promised to be stable. \\n\\n Extending DistributedRowMatrix api.. I kind of dubious about it as well, since it is also unusable without major FP infusion, and frankly kind of ancient. \\n\\n More likely, a completely new FP-laced distributed Matrix representation is desired. SparkBindings went that path and created FP-laced DRM api. But this is entirely Scala side abstraction, with Scala function literals etc. So if you are looking to create a java distributed matrix abstraction, this is not going to be useful at all either. \\n\\n So more likely, you need a completely new FP-oriented java API interface. Something like X2OMatrix.java. This will fragment project even further, but all marketing fluff excluding, that\'s the only realistic option i see that might work.  \\n\\n I would also question (kinda) the wisdom of a standalone distributed vector abstraction. On Hadoop side and spark side this abstraction is completely bypassed (it is assumed that real vector will always fit into single machine memory). In situations where vector might be formed as a result of distributed operation (e.g. A %*% x) the result is simply a distributed single-column matrix, from which the column can be always collected in front end via collection\\/slicing api.  \\n\\n             \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13962017\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Collapse comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-expanded\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHide\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-links\\\"\u003e\\n                \u003ca href=\\\"\\/jira\\/browse\\/MAHOUT-1500?focusedCommentId=13962017&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13962017\\\"\\n                   title=\\\"Right click and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-link\\\"\u003ePermalink\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n                                            \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details\\\"\u003e        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13962017_verbose\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13962017_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'07\\/Apr\\/14 16:59\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-07T16:59:43+0000\'\u003e07\\/Apr\\/14 16:59\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eAfter reviewing the newly announced \u003ca href=\\\"https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/h2o-matrix\\\" class=\\\"external-link\\\" rel=\\\"nofollow\\\"\u003ehttps:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/h2o-matrix\u003c\\/a\u003e and making a willful conjecture that it is what this issue is about (since it is still not explicitly confirmed on this Jira), I am changing my vote to -0. \u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eHere are components of my vote.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003e(1) +1 Do-ocracy &#8211; those who willing do things, and (what is especially important in our case) provide continued support for it, deserve componential +1 to begin with.\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n(2) Big +1 on using h20 as external dependency. I don\'t think we want to be in business of creating, maintaining, or merging with distributed execution engines, we should be just translating high level ML semantics to them.\u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n(3) +0 in-core API stability: This work must not change or deprecate in-core API contracts thus forcing existing mahout-math users to do unreasonable migration and refactoring steps and\\/or experience performance decline. Mahout-math is one of the few still very valuable components, this is important. (Current state of the things do not introduce such changes). \u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n(4) +0 in-core API augmentation. This work must not create API duplication (alternatives to existing contracts) or augmented API contracts that are either not adequately backed by the existing multitude of in-core matrix types or do not make sense for in-core structures.  (Current state of the things does not introduce such changes). \u003cbr\\/\u003e\\n(5)  -1 I still maintain that major Matrix and Vector in-core contracts do not provide adequate basis, nor are a good fit for for building shared-nothing generic environment. Thus, further partitioning of Matrix and Vector contract sets is required If distributed structures must share same hierarchy base with in-core ones. However, doing so will contradict positions (3) and (4)  above.  Which is why i maintain that the least painful way to address those is to create a separate hierarchy base for H20Matrix which would intersect some of high-level algebraic contracts with in-core contracts while bearing identical semantics.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eThis concern seems to be shared even by the authors of the code, if I am not misinterpreting the meaning of the comments here.\u003c\\/p\u003e\\n\u003cdiv class=\\\"code panel\\\" style=\\\"border-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeHeader panelHeader\\\" style=\\\"border-bottom-width: 1px;\\\"\u003e\u003cb\u003e\\\"H2OMatrix.java\\\"\u003c\\/b\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003cdiv class=\\\"codeContent panelContent\\\"\u003e\\n\u003cpre class=\\\"code-java\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"code-comment\\\"\u003e\\/\\/ Single-element accessors.  Calling these likely indicates a huge performance bug.\\n\u003c\\/span\u003e  @Override \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003epublic\u003c\\/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003edouble\u003c\\/span\u003e getQuick(\u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003eint\u003c\\/span\u003e row, \u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003eint\u003c\\/span\u003e column) { \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003ereturn\u003c\\/span\u003e _fr.vecs()[column].at(row); }\\n  @Override \u003cspan class=\\\"code-keyword\\\"\u003epublic\u003c\\/span\u003e void setQuick(\u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003eint\u003c\\/span\u003e row, \u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003eint\u003c\\/span\u003e column, \u003cspan class=\\\"code-object\\\"\u003edouble\u003c\\/span\u003e value) { _fr.vecs()[column].set(row,value); _fr.vecs()[column].\\n\u003c\\/pre\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\\n\u003cp\u003eI reserve the right to change my vote if components of my vote are affected by future changes. \u003cbr\\/\u003e\\nI will not raise objections or add points based on performance.\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-head\\\"\u003e\\n            \u003ca href=\\\"#\\\" title=\\\"Expand comment\\\" class=\\\"twixi\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-collapsed\\\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eShow\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n            \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-details flooded\\\"\u003e\\n                        \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13962017_concise\\\" href=\\\"\\/jira\\/secure\\/ViewProfile.jspa?name=dlyubimov\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar aui-avatar-xsmall\\\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\\\"aui-avatar-inner\\\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\\\"https:\\/\\/issues.apache.org\\/jira\\/secure\\/useravatar?size=xsmall&amp;avatarId=10452\\\" alt=\\\"dlyubimov\\\" \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Dmitriy Lyubimov\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13962017_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'07\\/Apr\\/14 16:59\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-07T16:59:43+0000\'\u003e07\\/Apr\\/14 16:59\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    After reviewing the newly announced  https:\\/\\/github.com\\/tdunning\\/h2o-matrix  and making a willful conjecture that it is what this issue is about (since it is still not explicitly confirmed on this Jira), I am changing my vote to -0.  \\n\\n Here are components of my vote. \\n\\n (1) +1 Do-ocracy &#8211; those who willing do things, and (what is especially important in our case) provide continued support for it, deserve componential +1 to begin with. \\n(2) Big +1 on using h20 as external dependency. I don\'t think we want to be in business of creating, maintaining, or merging with distributed execution engines, we should be just translating high level ML semantics to them. \\n(3) +0 in-core API stability: This work must not change or deprecate in-core API contracts thus forcing existing mahout-math users to do unreasonable migration and refactoring steps and\\/or experience performance decline. Mahout-math is one of the few still very valuable components, this is important. (Current state of the things do not introduce such changes).  \\n(4) +0 in-core API augmentation. This work must not create API duplication (alternatives to existing contracts) or augmented API contracts that are either not adequately backed by the existing multitude of in-core matrix types or do not make sense for in-core structures.  (Current state of the things does not introduce such changes).  \\n(5)  -1 I still maintain that major Matrix and Vector in-core contracts do not provide adequate basis, nor are a good fit for for building shared-nothing generic environment. Thus, further partitioning of Matrix and Vector contract sets is required If distributed structures must share same hierarchy base with in-core ones. However, doing so will contradict positions (3) and (4)  above.  Which is why i maintain that the least painful way to address those is to create a separate hierarchy base for H20Matrix which would intersect some of high-level algebraic contracts with in-core contracts while bearing identical semantics. \\n\\n\\n This concern seems to be shared even by the authors of the code, if I am not misinterpreting the meaning of the comments here. \\n   \\\"H2OMatrix.java\\\"   \\n  \\/\\/ Single-element accessors.  Calling these likely indicates a huge performance bug.\\n   @Override  public   double  getQuick( int  row,  int  column) {  return  _fr.vecs()[column].at(row); }\\n  @Override  public  void setQuick( int  row,  int  column,  double  value) { _fr.vecs()[column].set(row,value); _fr.vecs()[column].\\n \\n  \\n\\n I reserve the right to change my vote if components of my vote are affected by future changes.  \\nI will not raise objections or add points based on performance.              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n   \\n    \\n    \\n    \\n                \\n\\n    \u003ca class=\\\"user-hover user-avatar\\\" rel=\\\"ssc\\\" id=\\\"commentauthor_13982237_verbose\\\" Schelter\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13982237_verbose subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'27\\/Apr\\/14 08:01\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-27T08:01:48+0000\'\u003e27\\/Apr\\/14 08:01\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e  \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv class=\\\"action-body flooded\\\"\u003e\u003cp\u003eWhat\'s the status here?\u003c\\/p\u003e \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap concise \\/\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e Sebastian Schelter\u003c\\/a\u003e\\n added a comment  - \u003cspan class=\'commentdate_13982237_concise subText\'\u003e\u003cspan class=\'date user-tz\' title=\'27\\/Apr\\/14 08:01\'\u003e\u003ctime class=\'livestamp\' datetime=\'2014-04-27T08:01:48+0000\'\u003e27\\/Apr\\/14 08:01\u003c\\/time\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e\u003c\\/span\u003e                    What\'s the status here?              \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n        \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n    \u003c\\/div\u003e\\n\u003c\\/div\u003e\\n                             \\n\\n\\n\u003cdiv id=\\\"comment-13982250\\\" class=\\\"issue-data-block activity-comment twixi-block  expanded\\\"\u003e\\n    \u003cdiv class=\\\"twixi-wrap verbose actionContainer\\\"\u003e\\n        \u003cdiv and copy link for a permanent link to this comment.\\\" class=\\\"activitymodule-link issue-comment-action\\\"\u003e\\n                    \u003cspan class=\\\"icon-default aui-icon aui-icon-small
